page.title: 01DUNSTON,ELSWICK & SCOTSWOOD.
page.content: This area straddles the{River Tyne and both banks of the river show a similar pattern of development . The riverside areas are occupied by derelict factory sites and areas of newer light industry,much of which is located within the area designated as an {Enterprise Zone} wherein financial advantages for new industries may be enjoyed . In{Dunston, Elswick and Scotswood, the lower valley slopes once the sites for terraced housing and industry dating from the nineteenth century, have seen much redevelopment in recent years . On the southern slope in Dunston and on the crest of the ridge in {Whickham}the housing types are more varied, with a mixture of interwar council housing estates, alongside private housing developments .
